snippet: New York City’s schools chancellor said in December that she would limit state exams’ role in measuring student progress, but test prep, and the anxiety it causes, is as robust as ever.
abstract: Test preparation in New York City public schools, and anxiety it causes both teachers and students, is as robust as ever despite promises by New York City’s schools chancellor Carmen Farina; she had said she would limit state exams’ role in measuring student progress, but decade of accountability-based reforms has so deeply changed classroom it will take long time for her message to have any effect.

byline.contributor: Ann Farmer, Kyle Spencer and Julie Turkewitz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: New York City’s schools chancellor said in December that she would limit state exams’ role in measuring student progress, but test prep, and the anxiety it causes, is as robust as ever.

headline.main: Test Prep Endures in New York Schools, Despite Calls to Ease It
headline.print_headline: Calls to Limit Role of Testing Haven’t Eased Preparation
